member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL
member.summary: Provides access to the OpenAL 1.1 API.

member.summary: Gets an instance of the API.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.TryGetExtension``1(``0@)
member.summary: Attempts to load a native OpenAL extension of type .
member.returns: true if the extension was loaded, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.GetExtension``1
member.summary: Gets an instance of the API of an extension to the API.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.GenBuffers(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates one or more buffers.
member.param: The number of slots to create.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.GenBuffer
member.summary: Creates an buffer.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.DeleteBuffers(System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Deletes and frees resources used for a set of buffers.
member.param: An array of slots to delete.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.DeleteBuffer(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Deletes and frees resources used an buffer.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.BufferData``1(System.UInt32,Silk.NET.OpenAL.BufferFormat,``0[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Fills a buffer with audio data.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.GenSources(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates one or more sources.
member.param: The number of slots to create.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.GenSource
member.summary: Creates an source.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.DeleteSources(System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Deletes and frees resources used for a set of sources.
member.param: An array of slots to delete.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.DeleteSource(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Deletes and frees resources used an source.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.SourcePlay(System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Plays a set of sources.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.SourcePause(System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Pauses a set of sources.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.SourceStop(System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Stops a set of sources.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.SourceRewind(System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Rewinds a set of sources.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.SourceQueueBuffers(System.UInt32,System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Queues a set of buffers on the source. All buffers attached to a source will be played in sequence, and the number of processed buffers can be detected using a call to .

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers(System.UInt32,System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Unqueues a set of buffers on the source. The number of processed buffers can be detected using a call to , which is the maximum number of buffers that can be unqueued during this call.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetBufferInteger.Frequency
member.summary: Sound sample's frequency, in units of hertz [Hz]. This is the number of samples per second. Half of the sample frequency marks the maximum significant frequency component.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetBufferInteger.Bits
member.summary: Bit depth of the buffer. Should be 8 or 16.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetBufferInteger.Channels
member.summary: Number of channels in buffer. > 1 is valid, but buffer wonâ€™t be positioned when played. 1 for Mono, 2 for Stereo.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetBufferInteger.Size
member.summary: size of the Buffer in bytes.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.Capability
member.summary: A list of valid Enable/Disable/IsEnabled parameters.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.Capability.Invalid
member.summary: Currently no state toggles exist for vanilla OpenAL and no Extension uses it.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.DistanceModel
member.summary: Used by AL.DistanceModel(), the distance model can be retrieved by AL.Get() with ALGetInteger.DistanceModel.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.DistanceModel.None
member.summary: Bypasses all distance attenuation calculation for all Sources.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.DistanceModel.InverseDistance
member.summary: InverseDistance is equivalent to the IASIG I3DL2 model with the exception that SourceFloat.ReferenceDistance does not imply any clamping.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.DistanceModel.InverseDistanceClamped
member.summary: InverseDistanceClamped is the IASIG I3DL2 model, with SourceFloat.ReferenceDistance indicating both the reference distance and the distance below which gain will be clamped.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.DistanceModel.LinearDistance
member.summary: AL_EXT_LINEAR_DISTANCE extension.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.DistanceModel.LinearDistanceClamped
member.summary: AL_EXT_LINEAR_DISTANCE extension.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.DistanceModel.ExponentDistance
member.summary: AL_EXT_EXPONENT_DISTANCE extension.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.DistanceModel.ExponentDistanceClamped
member.summary: AL_EXT_EXPONENT_DISTANCE extension.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.ListenerFloat
member.summary: A list of valid 32-bit Float Listener/GetListener parameters.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.ListenerFloat.Gain
member.summary: Indicate the gain (Volume amplification) applied. Type: float Range: [0.0f - ? ] A value of 1.0 means un-attenuated/unchanged. Each division by 2 equals an attenuation of -6dB. Each multiplicaton with 2 equals an amplification of +6dB. A value of 0.0f is interpreted as zero volume and the channel is effectively disabled.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.ListenerFloatArray
member.summary: A list of valid float[] Listener/GetListener parameters.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.ListenerFloatArray.Orientation
member.summary: Indicate Listener orientation. Expects two Vector3, At followed by Up.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.ListenerInteger
member.summary: A list of valid Listener/GetListener parameters.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.ListenerVector3
member.summary: A list of valid Math.Vector3 Listener/GetListener parameters.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.ListenerVector3.Position
member.summary: Specify the current location in three dimensional space. OpenAL, like OpenGL, uses a right handed coordinate system, where in a frontal default view X (thumb) points right, Y points up (index finger), and Z points towards the viewer/camera (middle finger). To switch from a left handed coordinate system, flip the sign on the Z coordinate. Listener position is always in the world coordinate system.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.ListenerVector3.Velocity
member.summary: Specify the current velocity in three dimensional space.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetSourceInteger
member.summary: A list of valid Int32 GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetSourceInteger.ByteOffset
member.summary: The playback position, expressed in bytes. AL_EXT_OFFSET Extension.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetSourceInteger.SampleOffset
member.summary: The playback position, expressed in samples. AL_EXT_OFFSET Extension.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetSourceInteger.Buffer
member.summary: Indicate the Buffer to provide sound samples. Type: uint Range: any valid Buffer Handle.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetSourceInteger.SourceState
member.summary: The state of the source (Stopped, Playing, etc.) Use the enum AlSourceState for comparison.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetSourceInteger.BuffersQueued
member.summary: The number of buffers queued on this source.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetSourceInteger.BuffersProcessed
member.summary: The number of buffers in the queue that have been processed.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetSourceInteger.SourceType
member.summary: Source type (Static, Streaming or undetermined). Use enum AlSourceType for comparison.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceBoolean
member.summary: A list of valid 8-bit boolean Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceBoolean.SourceRelative
member.summary: Indicate that the Source has relative coordinates. Type: bool Range: [True, False].

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceBoolean.Looping
member.summary: Indicate whether the Source is looping. Type: bool Range: [True, False] Default: False.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceFloat
member.summary: A list of valid 32-bit Float Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceFloat.ReferenceDistance
member.summary: Source specific reference distance. Type: float Range: [0.0f - float.PositiveInfinity] At 0.0f, no distance attenuation occurs. Type: float Default: 1.0f.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceFloat.MaxDistance
member.summary: Indicate distance above which Sources are not attenuated using the inverse clamped distance model. Default: float.PositiveInfinity Type: float Range: [0.0f - float.PositiveInfinity].

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceFloat.RolloffFactor
member.summary: Source specific rolloff factor. Type: float Range: [0.0f - float.PositiveInfinity].

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceFloat.Pitch
member.summary: Specify the pitch to be applied, either at Source, or on mixer results, at Listener. Range: [0.5f - 2.0f] Default: 1.0f.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceFloat.Gain
member.summary: Indicate the gain (volume amplification) applied. Type: float. Range: [0.0f - ? ] A value of 1.0 means un-attenuated/unchanged. Each division by 2 equals an attenuation of -6dB. Each multiplicaton with 2 equals an amplification of +6dB. A value of 0.0f is meaningless with respect to a logarithmic scale; it is interpreted as zero volume - the channel is effectively disabled.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceFloat.MinGain
member.summary: Indicate minimum Source attenuation. Type: float Range: [0.0f - 1.0f] (Logarthmic).

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceFloat.MaxGain
member.summary: Indicate maximum Source attenuation. Type: float Range: [0.0f - 1.0f] (Logarthmic).

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceFloat.ConeInnerAngle
member.summary: Directional Source, inner cone angle, in degrees. Range: [0-360] Default: 360.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceFloat.ConeOuterAngle
member.summary: Directional Source, outer cone angle, in degrees. Range: [0-360] Default: 360.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceFloat.ConeOuterGain
member.summary: Directional Source, outer cone gain. Default: 0.0f Range: [0.0f - 1.0] (Logarithmic).

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceFloat.SecOffset
member.summary: The playback position, expressed in seconds.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceInteger
member.summary: A list of valid Int32 Source parameters.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceInteger.ByteOffset
member.summary: The playback position, expressed in bytes.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceInteger.SampleOffset
member.summary: The playback position, expressed in samples.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceInteger.Buffer
member.summary: Indicate the Buffer to provide sound samples. Type: uint Range: any valid Buffer Handle.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceInteger.SourceType
member.summary: Source type (Static, Streaming or undetermined). Use enum AlSourceType for comparison.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceState
member.summary: Source state information, can be retrieved by AL.Source() with SourceInteger.SourceState.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceState.Initial
member.summary: Default State when loaded, can be manually set with AL.SourceRewind().

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceState.Playing
member.summary: The source is currently playing.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceState.Paused
member.summary: The source has paused playback.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceState.Stopped
member.summary: The source is not playing.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceType
member.summary: Source type information, can be retrieved by AL.Source() with SourceInteger.SourceType.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceType.Static
member.summary: Source is Static if a Buffer has been attached using AL.Source with the parameter Sourcei.Buffer.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceType.Streaming
member.summary: Source is Streaming if one or more Buffers have been attached using AL.SourceQueueBuffers.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceType.Undetermined
member.summary: Source is undetermined when it has a null Buffer attached.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceVector3
member.summary: A list of valid Math.Vector3 Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceVector3.Position
member.summary: Specify the current location in three dimensional space. OpenAL, like OpenGL, uses a right handed coordinate system, where in a frontal default view X (thumb) points right, Y points up (index finger), and Z points towards the viewer/camera (middle finger). To switch from a left handed coordinate system, flip the sign on the Z coordinate. Listener position is always in the world coordinate system.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceVector3.Velocity
member.summary: Specify the current velocity in three dimensional space.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.SourceVector3.Direction
member.summary: Specify the current direction vector.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.ContextError.OutOfMemory
member.summary: Out of memory. Unable to allocate memory.

member.summary: The specification revision for this implementation (major version). NULL is an acceptable device.

member.summary: The specification revision for this implementation (minor version). NULL is an acceptable device.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.OpenAL.GetContextInteger.AttributesSize

member.name: T:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext
member.summary: Provides methods to instantiate, use and destroy an audio context for playback. Static methods are provided to list available devices known by the driver.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the default audio device.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified audio device and device parameters.
member.param: The name of the audio device to use.
Frequency for mixing output buffer, in units of Hz. Pass 0 for driver default.
member.remarks: Use AudioContext.AvailableDevices to obtain a list of all available audio devices. devices.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified audio device and device parameters.
member.param: The name of the audio device to use.
Frequency for mixing output buffer, in units of Hz. Pass 0 for driver default.
Refresh intervals, in units of Hz. Pass 0 for driver default.
member.remarks: Use AudioContext.AvailableDevices to obtain a list of all available audio devices. devices.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified audio device and device parameters.
member.param: The device descriptor obtained through AudioContext.AvailableDevices.
Frequency for mixing output buffer, in units of Hz. Pass 0 for driver default.
Refresh intervals, in units of Hz. Pass 0 for driver default.
member.exception: Occurs when the device string is invalid.
Occurs when a specified parameter is invalid.
Occurs when the specified device is not available, or is in use by another program.
Occurs when an audio context could not be created with the specified parameters.
Occurs when an AudioContext already exists.

remarks.para: For maximum compatibility, you are strongly recommended to use the default constructor.
Multiple AudioContexts are not supported at this point.

The number of auxiliary EFX sends depends on the audio hardware and drivers. Most Realtek devices, as well as the Creative SB Live!, support 1 auxiliary send. Creative's Audigy and X-Fi series support 4 sends. Values higher than supported will be clamped by the driver.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified audio device and device parameters.
member.param: The device descriptor obtained through AudioContext.AvailableDevices.
member.exception: Occurs when the device string is invalid.
Occurs when a specified parameter is invalid.
Occurs when the specified device is not available, or is in use by another program.
Occurs when an audio context could not be created with the specified parameters.
Occurs when an AudioContext already exists.
member.remarks:
For maximum compatibility, you are strongly recommended to use the default constructor.
Multiple AudioContexts are not supported at this point.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.CurrentContext
member.summary: Gets the which is current in the application.
member.remarks: Only one AudioContext can be current in the application at any time, regardless of the number of threads.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.IsCurrent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the is current.
member.remarks: Only one can be current in the application at any time, regardless of the number of threads.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.CurrentError
member.summary: Gets the ALC error code for this instance.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.IsProcessing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the AudioContext is currently processing audio events.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.IsSynchronized
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the AudioContext is synchronized.

member.name: P:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.CurrentDevice
member.summary: Gets a System.String with the name of the device used in this context.

members.member:
\internal
Makes the specified AudioContext current in the calling thread.
The to make current, or null.
Occurs if this function is called after the AudioContext has been disposed.
Occurs when the AudioContext could not be made current.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.CreateContext(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the audio context using the specified device.
member.param: The device descriptor obtained through AudioContext.AvailableDevices, or null for the default device.
Frequency for mixing output buffer, in units of Hz. Pass 0 for driver default.
Refresh intervals, in units of Hz. Pass 0 for driver default.
member.exception: Occurs when a specified parameter is invalid.
Occurs when the specified device is not available, or is in use by another program.
Occurs when an audio context could not be created with the specified parameters.
Occurs when an AudioContext already exists.

remarks.para: For maximum compatibility, you are strongly recommended to use the default constructor.
Multiple AudioContexts are not supported at this point.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.CreateContext(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Creates the audio context using the specified device.
member.param: The device descriptor obtained through AudioContext.AvailableDevices, or null for the default device.
member.exception: Occurs when a specified parameter is invalid.
Occurs when the specified device is not available, or is in use by another program.
Occurs when an audio context could not be created with the specified parameters.
Occurs when an AudioContext already exists.

remarks.para: For maximum compatibility, you are strongly recommended to use the default constructor.
Multiple AudioContexts are not supported at this point.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.MakeCurrent
member.summary: Makes the AudioContext current in the calling thread.
member.exception: Occurs if this function is called after the AudioContext has been disposed.
Occurs when the AudioContext could not be made current.
member.remarks: Only one AudioContext can be current in the application at any time, regardless of the number of threads.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.Process
member.summary: Processes queued audio events.

remarks.para: If AudioContext.IsSynchronized is true, this function will resume the internal audio processing thread. If AudioContext.IsSynchronized is false, you will need to call this function multiple times per second to process audio events.
In some implementations this function may have no effect.

member.exception: Occurs when this function is called after the AudioContext had been disposed.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.Suspend
member.summary: Suspends processing of audio events.

remarks.para: To avoid audio artifacts when calling this function, set audio gain to zero before suspending an AudioContext.
In some implementations, it can be faster to suspend processing before changing AudioContext state.
In some implementations this function may have no effect.

member.exception: Occurs when this function is called after the AudioContext had been disposed.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.OpenAL.AudioContext.SupportsExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified OpenAL extension is supported.
member.param: The name of the extension to check (e.g. "ALC_EXT_EFX").
member.returns: true if the extension is supported; false otherwise.
